channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Considerable broken glass in road/on pavement, 13th June
item.description:
Appeared overnight a few night ago but now glass smashed further by traffic, spreading across the road with a tendency to flick further afield as drivers try & park. Dangerous for all, especially children attending St Anthony's primary school
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Genoa Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rain water drain in road is totally blocked and causes flooding of the road during rainfall., 13th June
item.description:
Drain totally blocked and causes flooding of the road, especially during heavy rain like what is expected over the next 24 hours.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wrotham Road, East Wickham, London

item.title: Household Rubbish Dumped Again, 13th June
item.description:
The scum were out again last night at 23:30 dumping there old wardrobes and carpet in the park. Must have been heavy because they had to use a trolley to get it there. The worst part was two people actually walked past them while they were doing it. Absolutely no shame. England’s green and pleasant land.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hutchins Road, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Following on from report 7593932, 13th June
item.description:
Following on from the fallen tree branch reported under 7593932, the chain link fence line in this section is still broken. Please could we ask for someone to come and repair.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Water Lane, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Still have not been done and the bit that is now growing up my home, 13th June

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Wateringbury Close, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Graffitit on side of buiilding, 13th June
item.description:
Hi there, We've got graffiti on the side of our building again. Please can it be removed and yes hackney council are our landlord. Many thanks

item.title: Septic tank sewage spill on road, 13th June
item.description:
Sewage was left on the corner of Tylney Road and Canon Road on 12th June. With sewage running down Canon Road along the public path and and roadway. The smell is awful as well as being a hazard to pedestrians near the busy main road. The road and path need to be cleaned as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Canon Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping beside bins ., 13th June
item.description:
Once again you have not emptied the black bins and this is attracting other rubbish, wooden pallets on this occasion. If you do not empty these bins weekly they will become overfull and that attracts fly tippers who see a mess and feel they can add to it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Buckingham Avenue, Whetstone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown foliage base of tree by zebra crossing, 13th June
item.description:
Established tree on north side of zebra crossing at Lambeth Road SE1 7DF junction with Lambeth Walk. At the base of the tree there is so much overgrown vegetation it dangerously obscures pedestrians waiting to cross at the zebra crossing. Traffic travelling east towards the crossing is unable to see pedestrians waiting because of the vegetation at the base of the tree
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 130-134, Lambeth Road, Lambeth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
